content: How do you pronounce this? There is the Hebrew word like this, “ger,” “gair,” single syllable. SAME MEANING, same layers. Stranger in a strange land? Ger in the land that is not yours. Passover coming up! We were gerim (pl. ger) in the land of Egypt. Commandment: Do not hurt the ger, since his lack is really your own. Now, from the biblical towards the contemporary … Thanks for the post!
